intro: Dalbergia congensis, commonly known as African rosewood, is a tropical tree native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its dense, dark-colored wood. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can grow in a variety of habitats, including forests and savannas. Due to its valuable wood, it is also considered a threatened species in some areas.
